alert.note: Alert for Big Horn (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 6:14AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: .High water levels will continue today into tonight due to high elevation snowmelt from the Bighorn mountains. Snowmelt will decrease tonight through Tuesday night. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Creek, stream, and river flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following counties, Big Horn and Washakie. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Water levels rose overnight with Medicine Lodge Creek near Hyattville seeing the most significant rises. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 AM MDT, the stage reading at Medicine Lodge Creek near Hyattville was 5.1 feet. Flood stage at this site is 4.0 feet. Minor to moderate flooding is likely along this creek. Ten Sleep Creek near Ten Sleep had a stage reading of 4.0 feet as of 530 AM MDT. Flood stage at this site is 4.5 feet. - Some locations that will experience flooding may include... Medicine Lodge Archaeological Site. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid making camp near streams or creeks.
